item.title: Testing Go gRPC Server Using an in-memory Buffer with `bufconn`
item.description: It can be cumbersome to setup a testing environment targeting a live server to implement full API testing against your gRPC server. Even spinning up a server from your test file can lead to unintended consequences that require you to allocate a TCP port (parallel runs, multiple runs under same CI server). bufconn is a package which provides a Listener object that implements net.Conn. We can substitute this listener in a gRPC server - allowing us to spin up a server that acts as a full-fledged server that can be used for testing that talks over an in-memory buffer instead of a real port.
